title: Distributive Property
text: The distributive property states that sum of the factor times each term in the sum is the product of a factor times a sum. So, we can rewrite the equation as the sum of the product of the first term in the first parentheses times the second parentheses plus the second term in the first parentheses time the second parentheses: $$2x\left(3x^2-x-\left(+4\right)\right)+1\left(3x^2-x+4\right)$$.
speech: The distributive property states that sum of the factor times each term in the sum is the product of a factor times a sum. So, we can rewrite the equation as the sum of the product of the first term in the first parentheses times the second parentheses plus the second term in the first parentheses time the second parentheses:  2 x parentheses 3 x squared, minus x minus, parentheses positive 4   plus 1 times parentheses, 3 x squared, minus x plus 4  .
pacedSpeech: The distributive property states that sum of the factor times each term in the sum is the product of a factor times a sum. So, we can rewrite the equation as the sum of the product of the first term in the first parentheses times the second parentheses plus the second term in the first parentheses time the second parentheses:   2 x  3 x squared, minus x minus,  positive 4   plus 1 times , 3 x squared, minus x plus 4

title: Multiplication
text: The next step is to distribute the $$2x$$. We do not need to distribute the $$1$$ in the second expression since anything multiplied by $$1$$ is itself. Remember: multiply the coefficients and add the exponents.

title: Combine Like Terms
text: Now we can combine like terms to simplify the expression. The $$x^3$$ and constant terms are in their simplest forms since there are no other like terms.
speech: Now we can combine like terms to simplify the expression. The  x cubed  and constant terms are in their simplest forms since there are no other like terms.

title: Combining $$x^2$$ Terms
text: Since $$-2x^2$$ and $$3x^2$$ share $$x^2$$, these coefficients can be added to simplify the $$x^2$$ term.

title: Simplified Expression
text: Since there are no more terms to simplify, we can write the expression as the sum of the simplified terms: $$6x^3+x^2+7x+4$$.
speech: Since there are no more terms to simplify, we can write the expression as the sum of the simplified terms:  6 x cubed, plus x squared plus 7 x plus 4 .
